author: EFE
title: S√°nchez celebra la salida de Vox de gobiernos auton√≥micos: "Es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a" - La Opini√≥n de M√°laga
text: Cumbre de la OTAN S√°nchez celebra la salida de Vox de gobiernos auton√≥micos: "Es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a" El presidente espa√±ol conf√≠a en que el incremento del esfuerzo de la OTAN en su flanco sur sirva para hacer frente a las organizaciones criminales que fomentan la migraci√≥n irregular EFE El presidente del Gobierno, [Pedro S√°nchez](/tags/pedro-sanchez-2/), ha celebrado este jueves la salida de Vox de los gobiernos auton√≥micos que compart√≠a con PP y ha subrayado el hecho de que la ultraderecha no vaya a estar en esos ejecutivos: "Hoy es un gran d√≠a para Espa√±a". S√°nchez se ha referido a la ruptura de los gobiernos auton√≥micos del PP y Vox en la rueda de prensa con la que ha cerrado su agenda en Washington para participar en la cumbre de la OTAN. Para el jefe del Ejecutivo, m√°s all√° de qui√©n pueda beneficiarse pol√≠ticamente de esa ruptura, lo importante es que se va a beneficiar la mayor√≠a social de los espa√±oles. "Espa√±a es hoy un pa√≠s mejor, y, por tanto, no puedo ocultar mi alegr√≠a y mi felicidad (...) bien est√° lo que bien acaba", ha recalcado antes de insistir en que celebra que acabe algo que jam√°s tuvo que suceder en [Espa√±a](/tags/espana-2/), la entrada de la ultraderecha en gobiernos de comunidades. Ahora cree que el PP debe hacerse la pregunta de si est√° dispuesto a romper con las pol√≠ticas que ha aprobado con Vox, y considera que el principal partido de la oposici√≥n tiene una oportunidad y "la prueba del algod√≥n" en la reforma de la ley de Extranjer√≠a. Al respecto ha se√±alado que el hecho cierto es que hay 6.000 menores extranjeros en Canarias y hay que dar una soluci√≥n, momento en el que ha subrayado que ser un partido de estado exige dar soluciones a los problemas y los desaf√≠os de los ciudadanos vivan donde vivan. Tambi√©n ha reclamado al [PP](/tags/pp/) que sea quien tome la iniciativa y rompa los acuerdos con Vox que tienen en ayuntamientos de toda Espa√±a. Ante la pregunta de si estar√≠a dispuesto a que el [PSOE](/tags/psoe/) garantizara la estabilidad de los gobiernos del PP de los que sale Vox, como han defendido ya algunos dirigentes del partido, S√°nchez se ha limitado a se√±alar que en los sitios en los que el PSOE es oposici√≥n va a seguir haciendo una oposici√≥n constructiva, como ha afirmado que ha hecho siempre. "Por tanto, depender√° de las pol√≠ticas que proponga el Gobierno auton√≥mico de turno a la Asamblea correspondiente el que cuente con el apoyo o no del Partido Socialista", ha a√±adido. Ha insistido el presidente del Gobierno en que la estrategia del l√≠der del PP, Alberto N√∫√±ez Feij√≥o, de gobernar con la ultraderecha ha fracasado y eso supone una gran noticia haciendo un balance de las cosas que han aprobado esos gobiernos auton√≥micos que compart√≠an. Entre ellas ha citado la ley de Concordia aprobada este jueves en las Cortes valencianas que deroga la anterior ley de Memoria Democr√°tica y que ha dicho que contraviene el Derecho Internacional Humanitario, tal y como alert√≥ Naciones Unidas. Por ello ha reiterado que lo importante m√°s all√° de la ruptura de los gobiernos auton√≥micos es saber qu√© pol√≠ticas va a hacer el PP y si este partido va a ser el que va a romper ahora los gobiernos locales que comparte con Vox. Ve bien a Biden S√°nchez ha asegurado que ha visto "bien" a su hom√≥logo en Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, quien est√° cuestionado como candidato a la reelecci√≥n tras el debate televisado en el que se enfrent√≥ a Donald Trump, al tiempo que le ha agradecido su compromiso "rotundo" con la OTAN. S√°nchez ha mostrado su respeto con la elecci√≥n del pueblo estadounidense en las elecciones presidenciales de noviembre, si bien ha recalcado que como presidente progresista va a defender la opci√≥n de [Biden](/tags/joe-biden/). "A partir de ah√≠, yo he visto bien a Biden. Ha estado presente en todos los debates y en todos los plenarios, a diferencia de otros que se han ido ausentando. √âl ha estado constantemente presente en los debates", ha asegurado el jefe del Ejecutivo en rueda de prensa desde Washington tras la cumbre de la OTAN. S√°nchez tambi√©n ha agradecido al presidente estadounidense el compromiso "rotundo" con la OTAN que ha demostrado en la celebraci√≥n del 75 aniversario de la Alianza. "A partir de ah√≠, depende de √©l y de la decisi√≥n que tome el presidente Biden y el Partido Dem√≥crata sobre qui√©n debe encabezar la opci√≥n progresista en las pr√≥ximas elecciones presidenciales", ha indicado. Sin embargo, esta misma noche, el presidente estadounidense se ha referido err√≥neamente al mandatario ucraniano, Volodimir Zelenski, al [presentarle como "presidente Putin"](/internacional/2024/07/12/biden-presenta-error-zelenski-presidente-105530916.html). "Quiero ceder la palabra al presidente de Ucrania, que tiene tanto coraje como determinaci√≥n. Por favor, denle la bienvenida al presidente Putin", ha declarado Biden, que se ha retirado del podio pero r√°pidamente ha tenido que volver para aclarar que "Zelenski" va a "vencer a Putin" y que est√° "tan concentrado en vencer a Putin que todos tenemos que preocuparnos por eso". Biden lleva varios d√≠as apareciendo en medios estadounidenses para revertir [la imagen de debilidad que le granje√≥ el debate en Atlanta](/internacional/2024/06/28/panico-democrata-debacle-biden-debate-trump-104428142.html), donde se mostr√≥ debilitado e impreciso frente a Trump. El propio presidente estadounidense reconoci√≥ que hab√≠a hecho un mal debate, algo que atribuy√≥ al cansancio de campa√±a. Ante esta situaci√≥n, m√°s de una decena de congresistas dem√≥cratas han pedido p√∫blicamente un cambio de candidatura. [Cruz de Humilladero: una piscina sin horario ni control](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malaga/2024/07/11/cruz-humilladero-piscina-horario-control-105470482.html) [Comienza el derribo del antiguo hotel Los √Ålamos de Torremolinos](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/costa-sol-occidental/2024/07/11/comienza-derribo-antiguo-hotel-alamos-105470859.html) [M√°laga sondea ya convertir a la Rosaleda en un estadio 'Arena' para f√∫tbol y conciertos](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malaga/2024/07/10/malaga-convertir-rosaleda-estadio-conciertos-105457430.html) [El cierre parcial del Gran Hotel Guadalp√≠n Ban√∫s amenaza el futuro de 180 empleados](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/marbella/2024/07/10/cierre-parcial-gran-hotel-guadalpin-105419640.html) [El balneario romano de M√°laga con m√°s de 2.000 a√±os en el que se ba√±√≥ Julio C√©sar](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malaga/2024/07/10/balneario-romano-malaga-abierto-bano-julio-cesar-90301240.html) [Controlado el incendio forestal de Coritjo Jurado](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malaga/2024/07/10/declarado-incendio-forestal-malaga-105449927.html) [Llegan los avisos amarillos por altas temperaturas en toda la provincia de M√°laga](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/malaga/2024/07/10/avisos-amarillos-altas-temperaturas-malaga-105446593.html) [Advertencia de la Polic√≠a Nacional: hay n√∫meros de tel√©fono que pueden vaciarte la cuenta](https://www.laopiniondemalaga.es/sociedad/2024/07/10/advertencia-policia-nacional-hay-numeros-105457641.html)

author: elDiarioAR
title: Messi lanz√≥ su productora global ‚Äú525 Rosario‚Äù junto a su familia - elDiarioAR.com
text:
Se anunci√≥ el lanzamiento de ‚Äú525 Rosario‚Äù, una nueva productora global que tiene a Lionel Messi y su familia como supervisores directos, con el objetivo de convertirse en un referente en la industria del entretenimiento. Este ambicioso proyecto, que toma su nombre en honor a la ciudad natal de Messi en Rosario, trabajar√° en asociaci√≥n con Smuggler Entertainment, responsable de importantes producciones sobre la carrera del astro argentino, como ‚ÄúMessi¬¥s World Cup: The rise of a legend‚Äù y ‚ÄúMessi meets America‚Äù.
‚Äú525 Rosario‚Äù se dedicar√° al desarrollo y producci√≥n de contenido premium para televisi√≥n, cine y deportes en vivo, adem√°s de eventos comunitarios. Tambi√©n se encargar√° de la producci√≥n de comerciales y contenido relacionado con deportistas de todo el mundo, incluido Messi , seg√∫n inform√≥ la compa√±√≠a en un comunicado.
üëâüèª "525rosario": La nueva productora global de contenidos de Leo Messi.
üìπ El astro argentino public√≥ un video para dar a conocer su nuevo proyecto familiar.
üìå Estar√° destinada a contenido global y extensi√≥n de la actividad empresarial del 10. pic.twitter.com/H4nF2XP3mk
‚Äî Noticias Argentinas (@NAagencia) September 19, 2024 El proyecto ser√° supervisado tanto por la familia Messi como por Tim Pastore, director ejecutivo de Smuggler Entertainment, asegurando as√≠ la calidad y coherencia del contenido que se genere.
El propio Messi expres√≥ su entusiasmo por el nuevo emprendimiento, asegurando que siempre ha tenido una fuerte conexi√≥n con el entretenimiento, tanto dentro como fuera de la cancha: ‚ÄúTener la oportunidad de expandir el proyecto que creamos con Smuggler Entertainment para crear contenido y experiencias a escala global es algo que realmente me motiva‚Äù, afirmo el delantero del Inter Miami.
Con oficinas en Miami y Los √Ångeles, ‚Äú525 Rosario‚Äù se posiciona como un jugador clave en la industria del entretenimiento global. El objetivo, seg√∫n comunicaron desde la familia Messi, es ‚Äúinspirar y conectar con personas de todo el mundo de una manera completamente nueva‚Äù, aportando innovadoras narrativas y producciones con un enfoque global.
Con esta nueva productora, Messi no solo busca consolidar su legado en el deporte, sino tambi√©n expandir su influencia hac√≠a otros √°mbitos, como el cine y la televisi√≥n. La participaci√≥n activa de su familia en este proyecto refuerza la idea de que ‚Äú525 Rosario‚Äù ser√° un emprendimiento √≠ntimamente ligado a los valores y visi√≥n del futbolista argentino
CRM con informaci√≥n de la agencia NA

author: Adetutu Sobowale
title: 'Whatever happens is predestined from God,' says Emir Sanusi
text: The reinstated Emir of Kano, Muhammadu Sanusi, has said God predestined his reinstatement.

author: smueller
title: Authorities Release Names of Two Killed in Crash Near New London
text: Authorities Release Names of Two Killed in Crash Near New London NEW LONDON ( [WJON News](//wjon.com)) -- Authorities have released the names of the two people killed in a crash in Kandiyohi County [on Wednesday](https://wjon.com/at-least-one-person-is-dead-in-new-london-crash/). The Minnesota State Patrol says 80-year-old Myron Elsberry and 76-year-old Geneva Holland of Cambridge were driving east on Highway 9 near New London just after 11:00 a.m. Get our free mobile app Authorities say their SUV collided with a semi-truck, driven by 67-year-old Bruce Feldman of Renville, that was traveling north on Highway 71. Elsberry and Holland both died at the scene. Feldman suffered non-life-threatening injuries. Best Looking State Patrol Cars In (Almost) Every State For the past 10 years, the American Association of State Troopers has held a contest to determine which state has the best looking patrol cruiser. Nearly every state police agency submits their best photo of their sharpest patrol vehicle a chance to win the coveted cover photo on the association's annual calendar. From cop cars rushing through blizzards to vehicles on the Grand Ole Opry stage, here are this year's nominees. Gallery Credit: Rob Carroll LOOK: See how much gasoline cost the year you started driving To find out more about how has the price of gas changed throughout the years, Stacker ran the numbers on the cost of a gallon of gasoline for each of the last 84 years. Using [data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics](https://data.bls.gov/timeseries/APU000074714)(released in April 2020), we analyzed the average price for a gallon of unleaded regular gasoline from 1976 to 2020 along with the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for unleaded regular gasoline from 1937 to 1976, including the absolute and inflation-adjusted prices for each year. Read on to explore the cost of gas over time and rediscover just how much a gallon was when you first started driving. Gallery Credit: [Sophia Crisafulli](https://thestacker.com/stories/857/price-gas)

author: Amy Bojo Jan
title: Cat Lurks Around Building and Tries to Get in Multiple Times Until Family Takes Him on and Changes His Life
text:
A cat lurked around a building, trying to get in until a family took him on and changed his life.
Forrest the catNora
A cat lurked around a public housing complex and tried to sneak in multiple times. A young woman was there to visit her relative when she saw him pressing against the glass window by the entrance.
When she stepped outside, the cat made a beeline for her, chirping and rubbing against her legs. The longer she stayed with the cat, the more concerned she was about his safety, given how friendly he was and how other strays bullied him.
Hoping to get him off the streets, she contacted her local rescue, Little Wanderers NYC, for help.
He lurked around a building and tried to get inLittleWanderersNYC
"Forrest, aka Sir Chirps Alot, has had a wonderful impact on everyone he has met," the finder shared. Despite what he had gone through, "he was still open to human contact, which shows how much of a big, warm, pure soul he truly is."
Nora of Little Wanderers NYC received a call that late afternoon. Since no one else could help, she rushed to the location after work. "We are full to capacity, but we couldn't leave this little one out there," Little Wanderers NYC shared with Love Meow.
Forrest was immediately friendlyLittleWanderersNYC
They looked around the area but couldn't find the cat. It was getting late and rainy, but they decided to do one more lap around the housing tower.
"(The finder) thought sometimes he was down on the path under some scaffolding towards the basement," Nora told Love Meow.
He rubbed against the finder's legs for attentionLittleWanderersNYC
"And there he was in a little pile of wet leaves. We came up with the name Forrest together, and it has stuck. Not only is he mysterious and regal, but he is a huge goofball."
After Nora brought Forrest in the car, he checked out his surroundings and slinked his way into the driver's seat. He nuzzled up to Nora, bumping her nose with his as if to thank her for rescuing him.
Forrest was finally safeNora
Forrest was neutered and vetted, and it didn't take long for him to fit perfectly into his new home.
"If a black lab puppy was somehow stuck in a cat's body, it would be him. He loves to bound around and run, but at the same time, he knocks over and skids into things regularly. He loves toys, especially a wand toy with a mouse on it that he always wants to carry away to his scratch box."
He quickly made himself at homeNora
As soon as he met the youngsters in the family, he was smitten. "He had an immediate bond with them. He loves being near them at their feet or following them around."
"I suspect he was a dumped house cat. House cats don't just get accepted by feral colonies. He was thin, with debris and fleas, and his sleek black coat was thinning by his ears and back."
Forrest adores the youngsters in the familyNora
With his voracious appetite and access to nutrient-rich food, Forrest's coat has regained its beautiful shine.
"One of his favorite places is in the master bedroom on the California King - he knows he is the king in our hearts."
He quickly claimed the king-sized bed as his ownNora
Forrest has blossomed into his true self and become the family "therapy cat," offering cuddles while being spoiled like a baby. He provides his daily fix and then bounces off to play with his favorite toys.
"As we fostered him, it became harder and harder to imagine him anywhere but with us."
Nora
"As he settled in and showed every sign of loving our family dynamic and managing meeting the resident fur friends, we found letting him go to even a lovely home quite impossible.
"Any quirks he had we adored, from his chirps and chatter to his bounding around like a puppy."
Gemma and ForrestNora
"The day I got the call ended up being one of the best days of my whole family's life."
Forrest is happy-go-lucky, loves his playtime and adventures, and is always ready for a cuddle. He brings so much joy and laughter and has found his comfy spot with his now-forever family.
Nora
"We may not have planned on having another cat, but Forrest took those plans and fit himself right into our arms and hearts, young and old...and the king-sized bed, too."
Forrest has found his forever homeNora
Share this story with your friends. More on cats like Forrest at
Little Wanderers NYC on Instagram and
Related story:
Cat Sits Outside Building in the Same Spot for Days Until Woman Comes to Him, He Turns into Instant Lap Cat

author: Digital Desk
title: Heavy Rain Lashes Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Thoothukudi, Waterlogging in Several Areas- Republic World
text: Updated March 22nd, 2024 at 06:54 IST Heavy Rain Lashes Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Thoothukudi, Waterlogging in Several Areas News agency ANI shared the visuals from Thoothukudi where waterlogged roads can be seen. [India](https://www.republicworld.com/india) - 1 min read [Digital Desk](/anchors-and-authors/digital-desk/) Advertisement Chennai: Heavy rain lashed various parts of Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu early on Friday morning, with commuters facing difficulties. News agency ANI shared the rain visuals of Thoothukudi where waterlogged roads can be seen. Advertisement The weather department has predicted rain at one or two place in the state for the next few days. Advertisement Meanwhile, IMD had also predicted that rainfall activity will intensify along with the thunderstorm over Northeast India and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal & Sikkim during March 21 to 26 period. author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in St. Louis County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in St. Louis County, Missouri from 1901-2000 was 33.7. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did St. Louis County, Missouri experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in St. Louis County, Missouri history.

author: French Presstv
title: Amir-Abdollahian : le r√©gime sioniste n'a rien obtenu de la guerre √† Gaza
text: Le ministre iranien des Affaires √©trang√®res, Hossein Amir-Abdollahian, a d√©clar√© que le Hamas avait inform√© la R√©publique islamique d‚ÄôIran qu‚Äôil disposait de capacit√©s suffisantes pour poursuivre la confrontation avec Isra√´l dans la bande de Gaza assi√©g√©e pendant des mois. Amir-Abdollahian a d√©clar√©, jeudi 28 d√©cembre 2023, dans la ville sainte de Qom que plus de 80 jours se sont √©coul√©s depuis la guerre √† Gaza, mais le r√©gime sioniste n‚Äôa rien obtenu. ¬´ Selon les commandants du Hamas, seulement 14 % des capacit√©s de r√©sistance ont √©t√© endommag√©es jusqu‚Äô√† pr√©sent ¬ª, a affirm√© le ministre iranien des Affaires √©trang√®res. Amir-Adbollahian a ajout√© que la longueur des tunnels du Hamas est aujourd‚Äôhui sup√©rieure √† la superficie de Gaza, indiquant que les ateliers de fabrication de drones de la R√©sistance palestinienne n‚Äôont pas √©t√© ferm√©s m√™me une heure depuis l‚Äôop√©ration de Temp√™te d‚ÄôAl-Aqsa le 7 octobre. Il a not√© que de plusieurs officiers hauts grad√©s des forces de s√©curit√© et militaires du r√©gime sioniste ont √©t√© retenus captifs par le Hamas au premier jour de l‚Äôop√©ration de Temp√™te d‚ÄôAl-Aqsa apr√®s quoi plus de 70 % de la population de Gaza ont pris les armes et sont venus sur le champ de bataille pour d√©fendre leur pays. Le ministre a ensuite fait allusion √† la popularit√© croissante de la R√©sistance palestinienne, affirmant que c‚Äôest le Hamas qui a le dessus √† Gaza et √† la guerre. Le ministre iranien des Affaires √©trang√®res a ajout√© que le r√©gime sioniste, √† son tour, avait chang√© ses objectifs et sa strat√©gie √† plusieurs reprises lors de la guerre √† Gaza, mais n‚Äôavait pas r√©ussi √† atteindre ses objectifs. Ailleurs dans ses propos, Amir-Abdollahian a √©voqu√© le soutien total des √âtats-Unis √† l‚Äôinvasion isra√©lienne de Gaza et les messages r√©p√©t√©s de Washington demandant √† l‚ÄôIran de rester en dehors du conflit depuis le d√©but de l‚Äôattaque. Il a poursuivi en affirmant que les √âtats-Unis se sont ralli√©s de toutes leurs forces √† l‚Äôinvasion isra√©lienne et ont constamment envoy√© des messages √† T√©h√©ran selon lesquels ils ne cherchaient pas √† √©tendre la port√©e de la guerre. ¬´ Les Am√©ricains ont √©galement demand√© √† l‚ÄôIran de conseiller √† ses groupes alli√©s dans la r√©gion de ne pas prendre de mesures contre eux ¬ª, a-t-il not√© affirmant que l‚Äôappareil diplomatique iranien leur a envoy√© √† chaque √©tape sa r√©ponse d√©cisive au niveau officiel. ¬´ En m√™me temps, nous leur avons dit √† plusieurs reprises que nous ne cherchions pas √† √©tendre la guerre, mais vous mentez. Si vous ne cherchez pas √† √©tendre la guerre, vos bases ne devraient pas utiliser autant d‚Äôinstallations et d‚Äôarmes jour et nuit contre une zone limit√©e comme Gaza ¬ª, a-t-il d√©clar√©. Il a soulign√©, qu‚Äôil avait √©t√© sugg√©r√© aux Nations unies que les relations de l‚ÄôIran avec la R√©sistance soient prises en compte dans les plans d‚Äôapr√®s-guerre √† Gaza, mais l‚ÄôIran a r√©pondu que le peuple palestinien devrait d√©cider par lui-m√™me.
